articles.headline: Chastising Putin, Bush Says Russia Derails Reform
articles.snippet: President Bush also assured President Vladimir V. Putin  that Russia had nothing to fear from a missile defense system in Europe.
articles.abstract: President Bush also assured President Vladimir V. Putin  that Russia had nothing to fear from a missile defense system in Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE, June 5 — President Bush delivered a two-pronged message to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Tuesday, two days before their scheduled meeting in Germany, chiding Mr. Putin for derailing democratic reforms while assuring the Russian leader that he had nothing to fear from a missile defense system in Europe.

articles.headline: On Avandia, a Niche Strategy Now Under Stress
articles.snippet: GlaxoSmithKline’s effort to focus Avandia’s marketing on African-Americans could backfire as questions arise.
articles.abstract: GlaxoSmithKline’s effort to focus Avandia’s marketing on African-Americans could backfire as questions arise.
articles.lead_paragraph: Could a widely praised approach to drug marketing now be at risk of backfiring? That is a question confronting GlaxoSmithKline and its diabetes treatment Avandia, which is now clouded by concerns over the drug’s safety.

articles.headline: Is U.S. Safer Since 9/11? Clinton and Rivals Spar
articles.snippet: Senator Clinton has been criticized for defying a popular line of argument among some Democratic officials.
articles.abstract: Senator Clinton has been criticized for defying a popular line of argument among some Democratic officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Bush administration’s efforts to thwart terrorism at home have created a fissure among the three leading Democratic presidential candidates, with Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton coming under attack for saying that America is safer now than before 9/11 — contrary to a popular line of argument among some Democratic officials.
articles.byline: By Michael Cooper and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: F.T.C. to Sue in Bid to Halt Food Merger
articles.snippet: The F.T.C. said that the merger between Wild Oats and Whole Foods would lead to higher prices in markets where the chains compete.
articles.abstract: The F.T.C. said that the merger between Wild Oats and Whole Foods would lead to higher prices in markets where the chains compete.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wild Oats Markets may not become part of the natural foods empire of Whole Foods Market, after all.

articles.headline: Health Care as if Costs Didn’t Matter
articles.snippet: A big reason for the high cost of health insurance is the explosion of expensive, medically questionable care.
articles.abstract: A big reason for the high cost of health insurance is the explosion of expensive, medically questionable care.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a saner world, the place where you live wouldn’t have much effect on how doctors treated your back problems. In our world, it can make all the difference.

articles.headline: Doll Web Sites Drive Girls to Stay Home and Play
articles.snippet: Millions of girls are fueling the growth of interactive sites that offer virtual versions of traditional play activities.
articles.abstract: Millions of girls are fueling the growth of interactive sites that offer virtual versions of traditional play activities.
articles.lead_paragraph: Presleigh Montemayor often gets home after a long day and spends some time with her family. Then she logs onto the Internet, leaving the real world and joining a virtual one. But the digital utopia of Second Life is not for her. Presleigh, who is 9 years old, prefers a Web site called Cartoon Doll Emporium.
articles.byline: By Matt Richtel and Brad Stone

articles.headline: British Grocer Set to Dip Toe in U.S. Market
articles.snippet: Tesco is treading lightly to avoid the pitfalls that have tripped up other foreign retailers in the United States.
articles.abstract: Tesco is treading lightly to avoid the pitfalls that have tripped up other foreign retailers in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain’s largest retailer, Tesco, is finally ready for its American debut.
